abstract: Zachary Woolfe Critic's Notebook applauds genius of Conlon Nancarrow, industrious composer who wrote massive variety of rhythmic works for one unique instrument, player piano; praises Whitney Museum of American Art for perfectly pairing performances of Nancarrow's music with building-wide installation and spirited 11-day festival.
lead_paragraph: “Anywhere in Time,” the 11-day festival at the new Whitney Museum, included a seven-hour marathon of Conlon Nancarrow’s studies for player piano.

headline.main: Review: The Whitney’s Conlon Nancarrow Festival is an Enchanting Tribute
headline.print_headline: Player Piano in a Star Turn

snippet: “Anywhere in Time,” the 11-day festival at the new Whitney Museum, included a seven-hour marathon of Conlon Nancarrow’s studies for player piano.
